title: Robbie Williams’ Brit Awards performance in jeopardy after ‘suffering serious back pain’
text:
LET ME ENTERTAIN YOU Robbie Williams’ Brit Awards performance in jeopardy after ‘suffering serious back pain’ 
The pop star is fighting to be fit for tonight's show at The O2 in London Exclusive By ALLY FARRELL, Senior Bizarre Reporter 22nd February 2017, 12:16 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ROBBIE Williams faces a last-minute race to be fit for tonight’s Brit Awards after being crippled with “serious” back pain. 
The singer, 43, is due to perform at the ceremony and collect the prestigious Brits Icon prize at this evening’s London bash but has been battling injury in rehearsals. Getty Images 4 Robbie Williams will collect the Brits Icon award and perform at tonight’s ceremony 
A source revealed: “ Robbie is in absolute agony and it’s causing him and his team a lot of stress. 
“He struggled through his rehearsal on Monday but you could tell he was in serious pain. 
“It’s not improved at all since then and he has cancelled some of his promo today so that he can rest up. 
“But Robbie is a consummate professional. He is determined his performance will go ahead and has said he won’t let anything stop him taking to the stage.” Splash News Robbie is due to perform but his back problems are causing issues PA:Press Association 4 He has opened up about his health issues before, revealing he has arthritis in his back 
Robbie opened up about his health issues last year, when he revealed he has arthritis in his back which affects his ability to play football and dance. 
He said: “I’ve got arthritis in my back so I can’t put my foot through a ball. 
“I have very tight hamstrings, barely existent calves. I dance like a drunk dad at a wedding. But I’ve got to do something to fill the time on stage.” 
But despite his painful condition, the Angels singer doesn’t have a lavish area backstage to relax in. 
The 1975 are performing with a 100-piece choir at the ceremony, who have taken over the space which was supposed to be Robbie’s dressing room. A source said: “Being backed by a choir is completely unexpected and that’s what excited Matt about the idea. “Robbie’s band are in a disabled shower room. A posh drape has been fitted to cover up the toilet and shower area to make it look swanky but there is no disguising the wet room floor.” 
Ed Sheeran, Little Mix, Bruno Mars, Skepta, Coldplay Emeli Sande and Katy Perry are among other stars who will perform at tonight’s annual ceremony at London’s O2, which will be hosted by Dermot O’Leary and Emma Willis. 
Robbie is the most successful artist in Brit Awards history, with 18 trophies to his name – nine more than second-highest, Coldplay. Invision 4 Robbie is expected to be joined by his wife Ayda Field at the ceremony 
However he has given away all of his statues, aside from the one he will formally receive tonight. 
He told The Sun: "I've given them all away but Ayda made me keep that. 
"You know when Jose Mourinho gave away his Premier League medals straight away? 
"It's a monument to something that's already happened and I'm on to the next thing and I want more. Paddy McGuinness has one. He gave me comedy award. 
"Phil Taylor has one, Wayne Rooney gave me a pair of his World Cup boots for one — they're just in the house."
